Title (IGNORE): An Act relating to the regulation of broadband Internet; and making certain actions by broadband Internet service providers unlawful acts or practices under the Alaska Unfair Trade Practices and Consumer Protection Act
Description: Requires Internet service providers to adhere to net neutrality rules and to publicly disclose network management practices, performance and commercial terms in a manner sufficient for consumers to make informed choices regarding use of Internet and edge provdes to develop , market, and maintain Internet offerings. Public interest exception.
Sponsor(s): Kawasaki (D), Parish (D), Tuck (D), Drummond (D), Gara (D), Kreiss-Tomkins (D), Spohnholz (D)

Title (IGNORE): A resolution urging the United States Congress to overturn the FCC's order ending net neutrality through CRA
Description: A resolution urging the United States Congress to overturn the FCC's order ending net neutrality through CRA
Sponsor(s): Wielechowski (D), Gardner (D), Begich (D), Olson (D), Costello (R), Hughes (R), Wilson (D)

Title (IGNORE): An Act relating to the regulation of broadband Internet; and making certain actions by broadband Internet service providers unlawful acts or practices under the Alaska Unfair Trade Practices and Consumer Protection Act.
Description: Requires Internet service providers to adhere to net neutrality standards and to publicly disclose network management practices, performance and commercial terms in a manner sufficient for consumers to make informed choices regarding use of Internet and edge provdes to develop , market, and maintain Internet offerings.
Sponsor(s): Tom Begich (D), Gardner (D), Wielechowski (D), Hughes (R), Costello (R), Wilson (D), Stevens (R)

Title (IGNORE): A resolution urging the United States Congress to overturn the FCC's order ending net neutrality through CRA
Description: A resolution urging the United States Congress to overturn the FCC's order ending net neutrality through CRA
Sponsor(s): Kawasaki (D), Parish (D), Fansler (D), Tuck (D), Drummond (D), Gara (D), Spohnholz (D)

Title (IGNORE): An act to add Chapter 3.5 (commencing with Section 1775) to Title 1.5 of Part 4 of Division 3 of the Civil Code, and to add Article 2 (commencing with Section 3020) to Chapter 3 of Part 1 of Division 2 of the Public Contract Code, relating to communications.
Description: Prohibits specified actions by Internet Service providers; prohibits state agencies from contracting with an Internet service provider for provision of broadband Internet access unless the provider certifies that it does not engage in these specified activities.
Sponsor(s): De Leon (D), Wiener (D)

Title (IGNORE): An act to add Chapter 3.5 (commencing with Section 1775) to Title 1.5 of Part 4 of Division 3 of the Civil Code, and to add Article 2 (commencing with Section 3020) to Chapter 3 of Part 1 of Division 2 of the Public Contract Code, relating to communications.
Description: Prohibits specified actions by an Internet service provider, as defined, that provides broadband Internet access service, as specified. The bill would prohibit an Internet service provider from offering different levels of quality of service to end users as part of broadband Internet access service unless specified conditions are met
Sponsor(s): Sens. Wiener (D), Allen (D), Leyva (D), Dodd (D), Hill (D), McGuire (D), Monning (D), Skinner (D) Assemblymembers Bloom (D), Bonta (D), Chiu (D), Friedman (D), Kalra (D), Mullin (D), Ting (D)
Status: Signed by governor 9/30/18, stayed pending DC Circuit litigation

Title (IGNORE): Relative to Net Neutrality
Description: Urges the FCC to reinstate the 2015 Open Internet Order and urges Congress to intervene to protect net neutralityt and codify its principles in statute
Sponsor(s): De Leon (D), Wiener (D), Allen (D), Atkinds (D), Beall (D), Bradford (D), Dodd (D), Hernandez (D), Hertzberg (D), Hill (D), Hueso (D), Jackson (D), Lara (D), Leyva (D), McGuire (D), Mitchell (D), Monning (D), Newman (D), Pan (D), Portantino (D), Roth (D), Skinner (D), Stern (D), Wieckowski (D)

Title (IGNORE): Open Internet Customer Protections In Colorado
Description: Disqualifies an internet service provider from receiving high cost support mechanism money or other money received to finance broadband deployment if the internet service provider engages in certain practices that interfere with the open internet and requiring an internet service provider that engages in such practices to refund any such money received.
Sponsor(s): Reps. Hansen (D), Herod (D), Senator Donovan (D)

Title (IGNORE): An Act Concerning Internet Service Providers and Net Neutrality Principles
Description: Require Internet service providers to register and pay registration fees and require the Public Utilities Regulatory Authority to apply net neutrality principles to Internet service providers and enforce such principles with civil penalties.
Sponsor(s): Duff (D), Orange (D), Gentile (D), Slap (D), Conley (D), Bye (D), Winkler (D), Elliot (D), A'Agostino, Dillon (D), Hampton (D), Albis (D), Somers (D), Santiago (D), Moore (D)

Title (IGNORE): An Act Requiring State Contractors to Adopt a Net Neutrality Policy
Description: Require Internet service providers that are state contractors to adopt a net neutrality policy.
Sponsor(s): Winkler (D), Albis (D), Dillon (D), Slap (D)

Title (IGNORE): Opposing the Federal Communication Commission's Repeal of Net Neutrality rules intended to protect consumers and ensure fair and reasonable access to the internet
Description: Expresses the General Assembly’s opposition to the FCC’s repeal of net neutrality rules and urges Congress to either review the repeal under the Congressional Review Act or enact legislation reinstating and requiring the preservation of net neutrality.
Sponsor(s): Sen. Delcollo (R), Sen. Richardson (R), Sen. Townsend (D), Rep. Bennett (D), Rep. Briggs King (R),

Title (IGNORE): Sense of the Council Oposing the Repeal of Net Neutrality Rules Resolution of 2017
Description: Resolution to encourage Congress to block the repeal of Net Neutrality Rules from takeing effect and to support any future efforts to codify a free, fair, and open Internet.
Sponsor(s): Councilmembers Nadeau (D), Grosso (I), Silverman (I), Cheh (D), Allen (D), McDuffie (D), T. White (D), Todd (D), Gray (D), Bonds (D), R. White (D), Evans (D); Chairman Mendelson (D)

Title (IGNORE): An Act to Amend Title 46 of the Official Code of Georgia Annotated
Description: Requires any Internet Service Provider engaged in the provision of broadband Internet access service must publicly disclose accurate information regarding the network management practices, performance, and commercial terms of its broadband Internet access service; requires internet service providers to adhere to net neutrality rules.
Sponsor(s): Harold (D), Henson (D), Tate (D), Jordan (D), Seay (D), Williams (D)

Description: Directs state agencies to contract Internet-related services only with ISPs who adhere to net neutrality principles and directs state agencies to add contract language to procurement requirements that suppliers of telecommunications, Internet, broadband, and data communication services shall abide by net neutrality principles.
Sponsor(s): Governor Ige

Title (IGNORE): Relating to Broadband Service
Description: Requires ISPs operating in HI to comply with network neutrality rules and to be transparent with its network management practices, performance, and commercial terms of its internet services.
Sponsor(s): Baker (D), Gabbard (D), Galuteria (D)

Title (IGNORE): Relating to Broadband Service
Description: Requires ISPs operating in HI to comply with network neutrality rules and to be transparent with its network management practices, performance, and commercial terms of its internet services.
Sponsor(s): Brower (D), Ohno (D), Cachola (D), Cullen (D), Chang (R), Har (D), Hashem (D), Keohokaloe (D), Takayama (D), Takumi (D), Creagan (D), San Buenaventura (D)

Title (IGNORE): Relating to Broadband Service
Description: Requires ISPs operating in HI to comply with network neutrality rules and to be transparent with its network management practices, performance, and commercial terms of its internet services.
Sponsor(s): Chang (D), Espero (D), Harimoto (D), Tokuda (D), Baker (D), Green (D), Ihara (D)

Title (IGNORE): Relating to Broadband Internet Access
Description: Requires ISPs operating in HI to comply with network neutrality rules and to be transparent with its network management practices, performance, and commercial terms of its internet services.
Sponsor(s): Ing (D), Creagan (D), Gates (D), Johanson (R), Keohokalole (D), Lowen (D), Mizuno (D), Brower (D)

Title (IGNORE): An Act Relating to Internet Service Providers
Description: Rquires ISPs operating in ID to comply with net neutralitry rules and to be transparency about network management practices.
Sponsor(s): Jordan (D)

Title (IGNORE): Broadband Procurement & Disclosure Act
Description: Provides that no State broadband purchaser may award any contract to an Internet service provider that includes broadband service unless the contract provides specified terms concerning access to and impairment of Internet services. Requires each Internet service provider to make available on its website a clear and conspicuous statement informing end users of the Internet service provider’s network management practices and performance, including commercial terms offered to end users.
Sponsor(s): Ann Williams (D)*, Carol Ammons (D), Steven Andersson (R), Jaime Andrade Jr. (D), Kelly Burke (D), Jonathan Carroll (D), Kelly Cassidy (D), John Connor (D), Barbara Currie (D), Laura Fine (D), Robyn Gabel (D), Jehan Gordon-Booth (D), Will Guzzardi (D), Michael Halpin (D), Sonya Harper (D), Stephanie Kifowit (D), Mike Madigan (D), Theresa Mah (D), Natalie Manley (D), Christian Mitchell (D), Anna Moeller (D), Marty Moylan (D), Michelle Mussman (D), Deb Conroy (D), Natalie Phelps Finnie (D), Carol Sente (D), Juliana Stratton (D), Katie Stuart (D), Kathy Willis (D), Sam Yingling (D)

Description: Provides that no state agency may contract with an internet service provider for the provision of broadband internet access service unless that provider certifies, under penalty of perjury, that it will not engage in specified activities concerning intrenet access and use.
Sponsor(s): Cullerton (D)

Description: Requires broadband providers to publicly disclose accurate information regarding network management practices, performance, and commercial terms of its broadband internet access service sufficient for consumers to make informed choices concerning the use of the service; restricts broadband provideres from blocking lawful content, applications, services, or non-harmful devices subject to reasonable network management practices.
Sponsor(s): Andrade (D), Fine (D)

Description: Urges the President and Congress and to advocate for permanent adoption of net neutrality rules.
Sponsor(s): Cullerton (D)

Description: Urges the President and Congress to continue to protect net neutrality and Open Internet access
Sponsor(s): Hastings (D)

Description: Urges the President, Congress, and all relevant federal offices to continue to protect net neutrality and open Internet access.
Sponsor(s): Ammons (D), Slaughter (D)

Title (IGNORE): Iowa Internet Neutrality Act (companion to S.F. 2286)
Description: Requires a communications service provider to publish a provider's reasonable network management practices, performance, and commercial terms of its broadband service and prohibits communications service providers from blocking lawful content, applications, services, or nonharmful devices, unless pursuant to a reasonable network management practice.
Sponsor(s): Bennett (D)

Title (IGNORE): Iowa Internet Neutrality Act (companion to H.F. 2287)
Description: Requires a communications service provider to publish a provider's reasonable network management practices, performance, and commercial terms of its broadband service and prohibits communications service providers from blocking lawful content, applications, services, or nonharmful devices, unless pursuant to a reasonable network management practice.
Sponsor(s): Bowman (D)

Title (IGNORE): Prohibiting state contracts with internet service providers that do not adhere to net neutrality principles.
Description: Prohibits state contracts with internet service providers that do not adhere to net neutrality principles
Sponsor(s): Parker (D), Clayton (R), Curtis (D), Highberger (D), Ohaebosim (D), Probst (D)

Title (IGNORE): An Act Relating to Internet Service Providers
Description: Requires broadband Internet access service providers doing business with the state under the Kentucky Model Procurement Act to adhere to certain network management practices; creates the Fair Access to the Internet Act to protect consumers from broadband Internet access service providers who fail to adhere to reasonable network management practices.
Sponsor(s): Cantrell (D)

Title (IGNORE): An Act Concerning State Funds - Procurement of Services from Internet Service Providers - Restriction
Description: Provides that state funds may be used only by the state, a political subdivision, or a unit, an agency, or any instrumentality of the state or a political subdivision or by a person awarded a contract or grant by certain persons to procure services from an Internet Service Provider that does not block certain content applications, services, and devices, impair or degrade certain Internet traffic on a certain basis, or engage in certain commercial traffic preferencing.
Sponsor(s): Manno (D), Currie (D), Guzzone (D), Kelley (D), Peters (D), Pinsky (D)

Title (IGNORE): Commercial Law - Privacy and Net Neutrality Matters
Description: Provides that state funds may be used only by the state, a political subdivision, or a unit, an agency, or any instrumentality of the state or a political subdivision or by a person awarded a contract or grant by certain persons to procure services from an Internet Service Provider that does not block certain content applications, services, and devices, impair or degrade certain Internet traffic on a certain basis, or engage in certain commercial traffic preferencing.

Title (IGNORE): An Act Protecting Consumers by Prohibiting Blocking, Throttling, or Paid Prioritization in the Provision of Internet Service
Description: A person or entity engaged in the provision of broadband internet access service in the Commonwealth of Massachusetts shall not: Block unlawful content, applications, services, or nonharmful devices; impair or degrade lawful internet traffic; engage in paid prioritization.

Title (IGNORE): Internet Freedom Act
Description: A person engaged in the provision of broadband access or a telecommunications or Internet service provider that has entered into a franchise agreement, right-of-way agreement or other contract, may not engage in blocking, throttling, or paid prioritization.
Sponsor(s): Eldridge (D)

Title (IGNORE): An Act Relative to Providing for Net Neutrality and Consumer Protection
Description: Except when deemed necessary, Internet service providers (ISPs) shall adhere to net neutrality principles and shall disclose to all customers any action taken by the ISP having the effect of, the privileging, degrading, prioritizing, or blocking of any Internet traffic.
Sponsor(s): Rogers (D), Vargas (D), Arciero (D), Ashe (D), Balser (D), Barber (D), Connolly (D), Coppinger (D), Dykema (D), Farley-Bouvier (D), Fernandez (D), Garballey (D), Garry (D), Gentile (D), Gordon (D), Hecht (D), Higgins (D), Hogan (D), Kaufman (D), Khan (D), Koczera (D), Linsky (D), Livingstone (D), Matias (D), Miceli (D), Murray (D), Peake (D), Pignatelli (D), Provost (D), Puppolo (D), Smizik (D), Stanley (D), Ultrino (D)

Title (IGNORE): An Act Protecting Consumers by Prohibiting Blocking, Throttling, or Paid Prioritization in the Provision of Internet Service
Description: An entity engaged in the provision of broadband internet access service in Massachusetts may not block lawful content; impair or degrade lawful internet traffic on basis of content, application, or service, or use of nonharmful device; or enage in paid priorization.

Description: Resolution urging the Governor to issue an executive order requiring internet service providers with state contracts to abide by net neutrality principles
Sponsor(s): Bieda (D)

Description: Internet service providers serving Minnesota customers and those under contract to the state or political subdivisions prohibited from certain activities.
Sponsor(s): Thissen (D), Ecklund (D), Metsa (D), Pryor (D), Olson (D), Fischer (D), Pinto (D), Freiberg (D), Flanagan (D), Carlson (D), Lee (D), Davnie (D), Becker-Finn (D), Kunesh-Podein (D), Maye (D), Quade (D), Sauke (D), Schultz (D), Loeffler (D), Koegel (D), Considine (D), Omar (D), Mahoney (D), Moran (D), Lien (D), Halverson (D), Applebaum (D), Bly (D), Wagenius (D), Youakim (D), Lillie (D), Johnson (D)

Description: Relates to broadband service. Prohibits certain activities by Internet service proviers serving Minnsesota customers and those under contract to the state or political subdivisions
Sponsor(s): Latz (D), Little (D), Newton (D), Wiklund (D), Hawj (D)

Description: Urges the United States Congress to support and enact legislation reinstating net neutrality
Sponsor(s): Quade (D)

Description: Requires internet service providers to publicly disclose accurate information regarding the network management practices, performance, and commercial terms; and adhere to net neutrality principles; permits paid prioritization if there is a demonstrated public interest.
Sponsor(s): Sponsor: Ellebracht (D)

Title (IGNORE): Executive Order Providing for Internet Neutrality Principles in State Procurement
Description:
Directs the Department of Administration to incorporate into the state procurement process for internet, data, and telecommunications services criteria requiring recipients of state contracts to
adhere to internet neutrality principles.
Sponsor(s): Governor Steve Bullock (D)

Title (IGNORE): Internet Neutrality Act
Description: Requires internet service providers (ISPs) to publicly disclose accurate information concerning network management practices, performance and commercial terms of service; requires ISPs to adhere to net neutrality principles unless there is a demonstrated public interest.
Sponsor(s): Morfeld (D)

Description: State agencies may only contract with Internet service providers that adhere to net neutrality principles
Sponsor(s): Governor Phil Murphy (D)

Title (IGNORE): New Jersey Net Neutrality Act (companion to A1767)
Description: Requires Internet service providers to adhere to net neutralty principles, requires full disclosure to New Jersey consumers of any policies relating to privileging, degrading, or prioritizing Internet traffic; establishes the New Jersey Internet Service Provider Registry for the purpose of making Internet service quality and pricing information readily available to New Jersey consumers
Sponsor(s): Primary sponsors: Cruz-Perez (D), Diegnan (D); Co-sponsor: Gopal (D)

Title (IGNORE): New Jersey Net Neutrality Act (companion to S1577)
Description: Requires Internet service providers to adhere to net neutralty principles, requires full disclosure to New Jersey consumers of any policies relating to privileging, degrading, or prioritizing Internet traffic; establishes the New Jersey Internet Service Provider Registry for the purpose of making Internet service quality and pricing information readily available to New Jersey consumers
Sponsor(s): Primary sponsors: Quijano (D), DeAngelo (D), Mukherji (D), Holley (D); co-sponsors: Kennedy (D), Danielsen (D), McKeon (D)

Title (IGNORE): An Act concerning eligibility for public contracts (companion to A 2132)
Description: Prohibits awarding of public contracts to internet service providers, unless internet service providers adhere to principle of net neutrality
Sponsor(s): Turner (D), Singleton (D)

Title (IGNORE): An Act concerning eligibility for public contracts (companion to S1802)
Description: Prohibits awarding of public contracts to internet service providers, unless internet service providers adhere to principle of net neutrality.
Sponsor(s): Sponsors: Chiaravalloti (D), Zwicker (D), Murphy (D); co-sponors: Calabrese (D), Mukherji (D), Swain (D), Tully (D)

Title (IGNORE): An Act concerning Internet Service Providers (companion bill to S2458)
Description: Directs Board of Public Utilities to prohibit internet service providers from installing broadband telecommunications infrastructure on certain poles or underground facilities unless internet service providers adhere to principles of net neutrality
Sponsor(s): Sponsors: Chiaravalloti (D), Zwicker (D); co-sponsor Mukherji (D), Calabreses (D), Swain (D), Tully (D)

Title (IGNORE): An Act Concerning Internet Service Providers (companion to A2131)
Description: Directs Board of Public Utilities to prohibit internet service providers from installing broadband telecommunications infrastructure on certain poles or underground facilities unless internet service providers adhere to principles of net neutrality
Sponsor(s): Cryan (D)

Title (IGNORE): An Act Concerning Cable Television Service
Description: Requires cable television company to commit to principle of “net neutrality” as a condition of approval of applications for municipal consent or system-wide franchise
Sponsor(s): Sponsors: Chiaravalloti (D), Zwicker (D), Calabrese; co-sponsors: Murphy (D), Mukherji (D), Swain (D), Tully (D)

Title (IGNORE): Broadband Access Unfair Trade Practices
Description: Relates to trade practices, requires broadband internet access service providers to adhere to net neutrality principles, enacts a section of the unfair practices act to prohibit and make subject to penalty blocking of lawful content, applications, services or use of a nonharmful device, impair or degrade lawful internet traffic, engage in paid prioritization.
Sponsor(s): McCamley (D)

Title (IGNORE): Prohibited Broadband Internet Services Act
Description: Relates to trade practices, requires broadband internet access service providers to adhere to net neutrality principles, enacts a section of the unfair practices act to prohibit and make subject to penalty blocking of lawful content, applications, services or use of a nonharmful device, impair or degrade lawful internet traffic, engage in paid prioritization.
Sponsor(s): Morales (D)

Title (IGNORE): Review FCC Net Neutrality Repeal
Description: Requests that the New Mexico congressional delegation encourage Congress to review the FCC's decision to repeal net neutrality
Sponsor(s): Senators Morales (D) and Rodella (D); representatives McCamley (D), Trujillo (D)

Title (IGNORE): Broadband Access Unfair Trade Practices
Description: Amends the Unfair Practices Act making it unlawful for any broadband service provider to block unlawful content, applications, services, or use a nonharmful device, impair or degrade lawful internet traffic, engage in paid prioritization, or unreasonable interfere with or unreasonably disadvantage user's ability to select and access internet service, make lawful content, etc.
Sponsor(s): Morales (D)

Title (IGNORE): Ensuring Net Neutrality Protections for New Yorkers
Description: Directs the New York State government not to enter into any contracts with Internet service providers that do not adhere to net neutrality principles
Sponsor(s): Governor Andrew Cuomo

Title (IGNORE): An act to amend the public sercice law, in relation to Internet neutrality; and to amend the state finance law, the general municipal law, the public authorities law, and the economic development law, in relation to requiring that procurement contracts require compliance with Internet neutrality requirements.
Description: Provides regulatory control of internet service providers by the public service commissions. Requires internet service providers to adhere to net neutrality. Only providers compliant may obtain permission to attach equipment on utility poles. State may enter into contracts with providers that adhere to net neutrality principles.
Sponsor(s): Hoylman (D), Bailey (D), Breslin (D), Comrie (D), Hamilton (D), Kennedy (D), Krueger (D), Mayer (D), Peralta (D), Persaud (D), Sepulveda (D), Serrano (D)

Title (IGNORE): An Act to Amend the Public Service Law and the State Finance Law, in Relation to Instituting Internet Service Neutrality (companion to S7183C)
Description: Relates to instituting internet service neutrality; provides the Public Service Commission with jurisdiction over monitoring internet service providers to certify that any provider qualified to do business in the state adheres to net neutrality principles; requires a certification for internet service neutrality in certain state contracts.
Sponsor(s): Fahy (D), Morelle (D), Barrett (D), Ortiz (D), Magnarelli (D), Gottfried (D), Englebright (D), Thiele (D), Simon (D), D'Urso (D), Glick (D), Lupardo (D), Jaffee (D), Zebrowski (D), Santabarbara (D), Colton (D), Cahill (D), Jenne (D), Galef (D), Mosley (D), Arroyo (D), Seawright (D), Pichardo (D), Lifton (D), Titone (D), Brabenec (R), Brindisi (D), Dinowitz (D), Vanel (D), Stirpe (D), Rosenthal (D), Steck (D), Abinanti (D), Richardson (D), Wright (D), Wallace (D), O'Donnell (D), Taylor (D), Niou (D), Quart (D), Carroll (D), Sepúlveda (D), De La Rosa (D), Weprin (D), Pellegrino (D)

Title (IGNORE): An Act to Amend the Public Service Law and the State Finance Law, in Relation to Instituting Internet Service Neutrality (companion to A8882C)
Description: Relates to instituting internet service neutrality; provides the Public Service Commission with jurisdiction over monitoring internet service providers; requires a certification for internet service neutrality in certain state contracts.
Sponsor(s): Carlucci (D), Alcantara (D), Savino (D), Sepulveda (D), Valesky (D)

Title (IGNORE): An Act to Amend the Public Services Law and State Finance Law, in Relation to State Contracts Being only with Internet Service Probhivers Compliant with Net Neutrality and Establishes a Revolving Fund for the Establishment of Municipal Internet Service Providers; and Making an Appropriation Therefor (companion bill A09057)

Title (IGNORE): An Act to Amend the Public Services Law and State Finance Law, in Relation to State Contracts Being only with Internet Service Probhivers Compliant with Net Neutrality and Establishes a Revolving Fund for the Establishment of Municipal Internet Service Providers; and Making an Appropriation Therefor (companion bill S07175)
Description: Requires broadband internet access service providers to publicly disclose accurate information regarding network management practices, performance, and commercial terms. Requires state contracts to be with internet service providers that are compliant with net neutrality and establishes a revolving fund for the establishment of municipal internet service providers; appropriates $250 million therefor.

Sponsor(s): West (D), Ramos (D), Lepore-Hagan (D), Stein (R), Sheehy (D), Holmes (D), Ingram (D), Miller (D), Howse (D)

Title (IGNORE): Oklahoma Net Neutrality Protection Act
Description: Prohibits state, government agencies, political subdivisions, public benefit corporations, or municipalities from purchasing of Internet services from providers that do not adhere to net neutrality principles; establishes procedures for the purchase of internet services through certain contracts; establishes grievance procedures for certain contracts; excludes certain contracts from the act; creates the Municipal Internet Service Provider Loan Fund; appropriates certain amount to fund.
Sponsor(s): Pittman (D)

Title (IGNORE): Relating to Internet service providers; and declaring an emergency
Description: Prohibits public bodies from contracting with broadband Internet access service providers that engage in certain network management activities based on paid prioritization, content blocking or other discrimination
Sponsor(s): Williamson (D), Holvey (D), Leon (D), Barker (D), Barnhart (D), Bynum (D), Clem (D), Doherty (D), Fahey (D), Gomberg (D), Gorsek (D), Greenlick (D), Helm (D), Hernandez (D), Keny-Guyer (D), Kotek (D), Lively (D), Malstrom (D), Marsh (D), McLain (D), Nathanson (D), Nosse (D), Piluso (D), Power (D), Rayfield (D), Salinas (D), Sanchez (D), Warner (D), Sollman (D), Frederick (D), Gelser (D), Taylor (D)

Title (IGNORE): Net Neutrality Act
Description: Requires internet service providers to adhere to net neutrality principles, to be administered by the Office of Attorney General. An internet service provider in violation of this act will be fined $1 million, have its charter revoked, or have its certificate of authority to do business in the commonwealth revoked.
Sponsor(s): Wheatley (D)

Title (IGNORE): Open Internet Protection Act
Description: Provides for disclosure requirements for broadband Internet access service providers. Requires internet service providers to adhere to net neutrality principles. Prohibits a Commonwealth agency or political subdivision from contracting or awarding grants or tax credits to a provider that does not comply. Imposes civil penalties.
Sponsor(s): Farnese (D), Blake (D), Schwank (D), Taraglione (D), Costa (D), Williams (D)

Title (IGNORE): Internet Neutrality and State Procurement
Description: Requires all future contracts for fixed or mobile broadband internet access services with the Division of Purchases within the Department of Administration and all other contracting units or official of any state agency be awarded only to service providers that adhere to net neutrality principles.
Sponsor(s): Governor Gina Raimondo

Title (IGNORE): Internet Service Providers - Net Neutrality
Description: Requires internet service providers contracting with a state agency, public authority, or municipality to adhere to net neutrality principles.
Sponsor(s): Kennedy (D), Abney (D), Shekarchi (D), Serpa (D), Marshall (D)

Title (IGNORE): Internet Service Providers - Net Neutrality
Description: Requires internet service providers contracting with a state agency, public authority, or municipality to adhere to net neutrality principles.
Sponsor(s): DiPalma (D), Pearson (D), Calkin (D), Goldin (D), Miller (D)

Title (IGNORE): The Net Neutrality Protection Act of 2018
Description: Any Internet access services purchased or funded by the state or municipality must be provided in an unbiased manner, consistent with net neutrality principles, so as to meet the state or municipality's minimum standards as the purchaser or funder of such services.
Sponsor(s): Regunberg (D), O'Grady (D), Ruggiero (D), Ajello (D), Filippii (I)

Title (IGNORE): South Carolina Net Neutrality Preservation Act
Description: Requires telecommunications or Internet service provider engaged in the provision of broadband Internet access service publicly to disclose acruate information regarding the network management practices, performance, and commercial terms of its broadband Internet access services sufficient for consumers to make informed choices regarding use of such services and for content, application, service and device. Requires service providers to adhere to net neutrality principles.
Sponsor(s): McKnight (D), Thigpen (D)

Title (IGNORE): South Carolina Net Neutrality Protection and Maintenance Act
Description: Requires telecommunications or Internet service provider engaged in the provision of broadband Internet access service publicly to disclose acruate information regarding the network management practices, performance, and commercial terms of its broadband Internet access services sufficient for consumers to make informed choices regarding use of such services and for content, application, service and device. Requires service providers to adhere to net neutrality principles.
Sponsor(s): Smith (D)

Description: Establishes certain provisions regarding the state procurement process for internet, data, and telecommunications services. Requires a service provider to publicly disclose all of its customers in the state, accurate information regarding network and transport management practices, performance and commercial terms. Requires service providers contracting with the state to adhere to net neutrality principles.
Sponsor(s): Senators Nesiba (D), Frerichs (D), Heinert (D), Kennedy (D), Killer (D); Representatives Ring (D), Bartling (D), Bordeaux (D), Hawley (D), Lesmeister (D), McCleerey (D), Wismer (D)

Title (IGNORE): Tennessee Neutrality and Internet Consumer Protection Act (companion to S 1756)
Description: Requires Internet service providers (ISPs) to adhere to net neutrality principles; requires those engaged in the provision of broadband Internet access service in Tennessee to publicly disclose accurate information regarding network management practices, performance, and commercial terms of its broadband Internet access services sufficient for a consumer to make informed choices regarding use of services and content, application, service, and device provides to develop, market, and maintain Internet offerings.
Sponsor(s): Primary: Clemmons (D); Cosponsors: Jernigan (D), Thompson (D)

Title (IGNORE): Tennessee Neutrality and Internet Consumer Protection Act (companion to H 1755)
Description: Requires Internet service providers (ISPs) to adhere to net neutrality principles; requires those engaged in the provision of broadband Internet access service in Tennessee to publicly disclose accurate information regarding network management practices, performance, and commercial terms of its broadband Internet access services sufficient for a consumer to make informed choices regarding use of services and content, application, service, and device provides to develop, market, and maintain Internet offerings.
Sponsor(s): Harris (D), Bowling (R)

Title (IGNORE): An Act to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 4; Title 5; Title 6; Title 7; Title 10; Title 12; Title 65; Title 67 and Title 68, relative to internet neutrality (companion to SB 2449)
Description: Creates an eight member taskforce to study issues related to net neutrality. Requires the taskforce to meet at least two times and file a report of its finding and recommendations to the General Assembly no later than January 15, 2019, at which point the taskforce will cease to exist.
Sponsor(s): Thompson (D)

Title (IGNORE): An Act to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 4; Title 5; Title 6; Title 7; Title 10; Title 12; Title 65; Title 67 and Title 68, relative to internet neutrality (companion to HB 2405)
Description: Creates an eight member taskforce to study issues related to the FCC's withdrawal of net neutrality rules. Requires the taskforce to meet at least two times and file a report of its finding and recommendations to the General Assembly no later than January 15, 2019, at which point the taskforce will cease to exist.
Sponsor(s): Harris (D)

Title (IGNORE): AN ACT to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 4; Title 5; Title 6; Title 7; Title 10; Title 12; Title 65; Title 67 and Title 68, relative to internet neutrality (companion to SB 2183)
Description: Prohibits an Internet service provider from engaging in the following activities when providing Internet service to the state: (1) blocking lawful content, applications, services, or nonharmful devices; (2) impairing or degrading lawful internet traffic on the basis of Internet content, application, or service, or use of nonharmful device; (3) unreasonably interfering with or disadvantaging either the state or state employee's ability to select, access, and use broadband internet access service; or (4) engaging in deceptive or misleading marketing practices that misrepresent the treatment of Internet traffic or content to the state.
Sponsor(s): Clemmons (D)

Title (IGNORE): An act to amend Tennessee Code Annotated, Title 4; Title 5; Title 6; Title 7; Title 10; Title 12; Title 65; Title 67 and Title 68, relative to internet neutrality (companion to HB 2253)
Description: Prohibits an Internet service provider from engaging in the following activities when providing Internet service to the state: (1) blocking lawful content, applications, services, or nonharmful devices; (2) impairing or degrading lawful internet traffic on the basis of Internet content, application, or service, or use of nonharmful device; (3) unreasonably interfering with or disadvantaging either the state or state employee's ability to select, access, and use broadband internet access service; or (4) engaging in deceptive or misleading marketing practices that misrepresent the treatment of Internet traffic or content to the state.
Sponsor(s): Harris (D)

Title (IGNORE): A bill to amend the Code of Virginia by adding in Article 7 of Chapter 21 of Title 15.2 a section numbered 15/2-2161, relating to net neutrality
Description: Provides that an entity engaged in the provision of broadband Internet access service in the Commonwealth shall not (i) block lawful content, applications, services, or nonharmful devices, subject to reasonable network management; (ii) impair or degrade lawful Internet traffic on the basis of Internet content, application, or service, or use of a nonharmful device, subject to reasonable network management; (iii) engage in paid prioritization; or (iv) unreasonably interfere with or unreasonably disadvantage (a) end users' ability to select, access, and use broadband Internet access service or the lawful Internet content, applications, services, or devices of their choice or (b) edge providers' ability to make lawful content, applications, services, or devices available to end users.
Sponsor(s): Wexton (D)

Title (IGNORE): A bill to amend the Code of Virginia by adding in Article 7 of Chapter 21 of Title 15.2 a section numbered 15/2-2161, relating to broadband services; prohibited features.
Description: Prohibits a provider of broadband services from offering or renewing services to consumers within any locality in the Commonwealth in which certain media is throttled, blocked, or prioritized on the basis of its content, format, host address, or source.
Sponsor(s): Sponsors: Carter (D), Roem (D); co-sponsors: Hope (D), Plum (D), Price (D), Rasoul (D), Simon (D)

Title (IGNORE): Internet Neutrality in State Procurement
Description: Requires all state agency contracts with internet service providers to include net neutrality protections.
Sponsor(s): Governor Phil Scott

Title (IGNORE): An act relating to protecting consumers and promoting an open Internet in Vermont
Description: Establishes consumer protection and net neutrality standards applicable to Internet service providers in Vermont which are enforceable under Vermont's Consumer Protection Act; specifies that standards apply to broadband Internet access service that is subject of or pertains to (1) pole attachments and cable line extensions; (2) wired and wireless facilities on or within State land and public highways and rights-of-way; (3) telecommunications facility sitting; (4) grants or awards through programs supported by the Vermont Universal Service Fund; (5) government contracts, including Executive, Legislative, and Judicial contracts for Internet service; and (6) state telecommunications policy and planning.
Sponsor(s): Sponsors: Stevens (D),  Sibilia (D), Hill (D); Cosponsors: Baser (R), Belaski (D), Botzow (D), Brumsted (D), Carr (D), Chestnut-Tangerman (D), Christie (D), Cina (D), Colburn (D), Connor (D), Conquest (D), Copeland-Hanzas (D), Dakin (D), Donovan (D), Dunn (D), Gannon (D), Gonzales (D), Haas (D), Head (D), Houghton (D), Howard (D), Jickling (I), Kitzmiller (D), Lanpher (D), Lucke (D), McCormack (D), Morris (D), Mrowicki (D), Noyes (D), O'Sullivan (D), Ode (D), Pajaha (I), Read (I), Scheu (D), Stuart (D), Sullivan (D), Troiano (D), Walz (D), Webb (D), Weed (D), Yantachka (D)

Title (IGNORE): An act relating to protecting consumers and promoting an open Internet in Vermont
Description: Requires internet service providers to comply with consumer protection and net neutrality standards. State procurement contracts for broadband internet access service require the internet service provider to certify that it is in compliance with consumer protection and net neutrality standards.
Sponsor(s): Primary: Lyons (D); cosponsors: Sirotkin (D), Ashe (D)
Status: Enacted; signed by Governor May 22, 2018, effective 7/1/2018

Title (IGNORE): An Act Relating to protecting an open internet in Washington state; and adding a new chapter to Title 19 RCW
Description: Requires a person engaged in the provision of broadband internet access service in the state to publicly disclose accurate information regarding the network management practices, performance, and commercial terms of its services sufficient for consumers to make informed choices. Requires broadband internet access service providers to adhere to net neutrality principles.
Sponsor(s): Hansen (D), Cody (D), Goodman (D), Pettigrew (D), Tarleton (D), Fey (D), Debolt (R), Berquist (D), Springer (D), Santos (D), McBride (D), Smith (R), Chapman (D), Slatter (D), Peterson (D), Wylie (D), Fitzgibbon (D), Morris (D), Stonier (D), Lytton (D), Sawyer (D), Robinson (D), Tharinger (D), Kagi (D), Pellicciotti (D), Dolan (D), Orwall (D), Valdez (D), Haler (R), Kilduff (D), Senn (D), Frame (D), Sells (D), Kirby (D), Stanford (D), Blake (D), Reeves (D), Clibborn (D), Macri (D), Kloba (D), Appleton (D), Stambaugh (R), Jinkins (D), Ormsby (D), Ryu (D), Hayes (R), Pollet (D), Doglio (D), Ortiz-Self (D), Riccelli (D), McDonald (R), and Gregerson (D)

Title (IGNORE): Washington Net Neutrality Act
Description: Declares an intent to: (1) Ensure that corporations do not impede competition or engage in deceptive consumer practices and that they offer service to customers on a nondiscriminatory basis; and (2) Ensure that the provision of internet services efficiently meets consumer needs with  lower prices and broader consumer choice while avoiding anticompetitive conduct. Requires internet service providers to adhere to net neutrality principles. Requires the director of the consolidated technology services agency to: (1) Adopt guidelines that identify and specify the state government's role as an internet customer; (2) Use that customer power to ensure implementation of this act; and (3) Establish sample master contracts for public entities to be used as an incentive for internet service providers to comply with the net neutrality standards. Creates the internet consumer access account.
Sponsor(s): Ranker (D), Conway (D) Darneille (D) Frockt (D) Hasegawa (D), Hunt (D), Keiser (D) Kuderer (D), Nelson (D), Pederson (D), Takko (D), Wellman (D), Rolfes (D)

Title (IGNORE): An act relating to protecting consumers by prohibiting blocking, throttling, or paid prioritization in the provision of internet service in Washington state; adding a new chapter to Title 19 RCW; and providing a contingent effective date.
Description: Prohibits a person engaged in the provision of broadband internet access service from: (1) Blocking lawful content, applications, services, or nonharmful devices; (2) Impairing or degrading lawful internet traffic on the basis of internet content, application, or service, or use of a nonharmful device; or (3) Engaging in paid prioritization. Authorizes the utilities and transportation commission to waive the prohibition on paid prioritization under certain circumstances.
Sponsor(s): Smith (R), Cody (D), Tarleton (D), DeBolt (R), Springer (D), Santos (D), McBride (D), Chapman (D), Wylie (D), Fitzgibbon (D), Peterson (D), Morris (D), Stonier (D), Kagi (D), Senn (D), Kirby (D), Stanford (D), Blake (D), Reeves (D), Kilduff (D), Clibborn (D), Macri (D), Pettigrew (D), Orcutt (D), Stambaugh (D), Ormsby (D), Ryu (D), Hayes (R), Pollet (D), Doglio (D), Ortiz-Self (D), Riccelli (D), McDonald (R), Jinkins (D), and Gregerson (D)

Title (IGNORE): West Virginia Net Neutrality Act
Description: Requires internet service providers to publicly disclose accurate information about network management practices, performance, and commercial terms of use; requires providers to adhere to net neutrality principles
Sponsor(s): Primary: Ojeda (D); Sponsors: Baldwin (D), Beach (D), Facemire (D), Jeffries (D), Prezioso (D), Romano (D), Stollings (D), Unger (D), Woelfel (D), Plymale (D)

Title (IGNORE): A bill to amend the Code of West Virginia, 1931, as amended, by adding thereto a new article, designated §1-7-1, §1-7-2 and §1-7-3, all relating to net neutrality for state government; providing legislative findings; defining terms; requiring the state to utilize net neutral internet services and associated activities; and providing exceptions thereto.
Description: Requires internet service providers to publicly disclose accurate information about network management practices, performance, and commercial terms of use; requires providers to adhere to net neutrality principles
Sponsor(s): Primary: Lovejoy (D); Sponsors: Canestraro (D), R. Miller (D), Fluharty (D), Hornbuckle (D), Robinson (D), Sponaugle (D), Barrett, (D) Byrd (D), Williams (D), Isner (D)

Title (IGNORE): An Act to amend 16.75 (1) (a) 1.; and to create 16.756 of the statutes; Relating to: state contracts for broadband Internet access service. (companion to SB 740)
Description: Prohibits state from contracting for broadband Internet access service unless the state determines that the service provider adheres to net neutrality principles
Sponsor(s):
Assemblymembers Anderson (D), Genrich (D), Hebl (D), Considine (D), Berceau (D), Zamarripa (D), Vruwink (D), Ohnstad (D), Sinicki (D), Spreitzer (D), Pope-Roberts (D), Brostoff (D), Crowley (D), Billings (D) and Hesselbein (D); 
cosponsored by Senators Erpenbach (D), Larson (D), Hansen (D), Carpenter (D) and Vinehout (D)

Title (IGNORE): An Act to amend 16.75 (1) (a) 1.; and to create 16.756 of the statutes; Relating to: state contracts for broadband Internet access service. (companion to AB 908)
Description: Prohibits state from contracting for broadband Internet access serice unless the state determines that the service provider adheres to net neutrality principles
Sponsor(s): Senators Erpenbach (D), Larson (D), Hansen (D), Carpenter (D) and Vinehout (D); cosponsored by Assemblymembers Anderson (D), Genrich (D), Hebl (D), Considine (D), Berceau (D), Zamarripa (D), Vruwink (D), Ohnstad (D), Sinicki (D), Spreitzer (D), Pope-Roberts (D), Brostoff (D), Crowley (D), Billings (D) and Hesselbein (D)

Title (IGNORE): An Act to create 100.80 of the statutes; Relating to: requirements and prohibited practices for Internet service providers and granting rule-making authority (companion to SB 743)
Description: Requires providers of broadband Internet access service to adhere to net neutrality principles; requires Department of Agriculture, Trade and COnsumer Protection to create and implement a complaint process for responding to violations of the bill's provisions.
Sponsor(s): Assemblymembers Anderson (D), Brostoff (D), Hebl (D), Vruwink (D), Berceau (D), Ohnstad (D), Taylor (D), Sinicki (D), Spreitzer (D), Crowley (D), Shankland (D); Senators Larson (D), Risser (D), Vinehout (D), Hansen (D), Carpenter (D), Johnson (D), Bewley (D)

Title (IGNORE): An Act to create 100.80 of the statutes; relating to: requirements and prohibited practices for Internet service providers and granting rule-making authority (companion to AB 909)
Description: Requires providers of broadband Internet access service to adhere to net neutrality principles; requires Department of Agriculture, Trade and COnsumer Protection to create and implement a complaint process for responding to violations of the bill's provisions.
Sponsor(s): Senators Larson (D), Risser (D), Vinehout (D), Hansen (D), Carpenter (D), Johnson (D), Bewley (D); Assemblymembers Anderson (D), Brostoff (D), Hebl (D), Vruwink (D), Berceau (D), Ohnstad (D), Taylor (D), Sinicki (D), Spreitzer (D), Crowley (D), Shankland (D)
